title-group.article-title: Quadratic Pencils and Least-Squares Piecewise-Polynomial Approximation

abstract.p: For a partition $\xi = (0 = \xi_0 < \xi_1 < \cdots < \xi_n < \xi_{n + 1} = 1)$ of the unit interval, $S^{km}_\xi, k > m$, denotes the space of piecewise-polynomials of order $k$ and of smoothness $m - 1$; this space can be represented as the graph of the appropriate linear operator between two finite-dimensional Hilbert spaces. It gives an approach to the C. de Boor problem, 1972, on uniform boundedness (with respect to $\xi$) in the $L_\infty$-norm of the orthogonal projections onto $S^{km}_\xi$, and we give the detailed analysis of a quadratic pencil (matrix-valued polynomial of the second degree) which appears in the case of a geometric mesh $\xi$ if $2m \leqslant k$. The explicit calculations and estimates of zeros of the "characteristic" polynomial show that in the case $S^{63}_{\xi(x)}, \xi(x)$ the geometric mesh with the parameter $x, 0 < x < \infty$, the orthogonal projectors are uniformly bounded.
